intro: Palicourea ceriantha, commonly known as the pink-flowered palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with a distinctive red calyx. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface, while the stems are slender and often twining. Palicourea ceriantha is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
